resources.string: When one of the five tetrominos appears at the top of the screen, the user can place the piece in any location they so choose. The tetromino will fall at a constant rate and will increase in speed if the user chooses a specific locaiton. The pieces can be rotated by tapping the respective piece. The pieces cannot be raised upwards. The tetromino pieces will fall until they meet some form of resistance, either the bottom of the screen or another tetromino block. The blocks will constitute a stack composed of multiple rows as the game progresses.The object of the game is to attempt to prevent the stacked tetrominos from reaching the top of the screen. Once the stack reaches the top of the screen, the game is over. When users fill an entire row with tetris blocks, the entire row is cleared, the blocks above that row are dropped downwards, and the user will receive an increase in score.
